data.title: Very bad frametimes
data.body:
I have found out that any game that was made in libgdx has some "Micro stuttering".
So I have made a simple game to measure the time between frames and it has a lot of lag spikes.
I have tested it on Android (Nexus 7) and Windows with activated vsync (so each frame should be at exact 16.67ms but it's often 30ms or 5ms).

The game and the function that calculates the frametime can be found here:
https://github.com/Teiby1/frametimetest/blob/master/core/src/de/teiby/frametimetest/FrametimeTest.java
It sums up all frametimes in a second that are not exact 16.67ms. On Android I get about 30ms-100ms and on Windows 1ms-10ms (fullscreen) and 10ms-50ms (windowed).
On both devices 60 FPS but it's not really smooth.

Use WASD or touch/mouse to move the square (but doesn't really affect the frametime).

Also here a logcat output when a frame took more or less than 4ms:
https://github.com/Teiby1/frametimetest/blob/master/android_measure.txt

You should run this testgame on a device that has a 60Hz monitor.

data.title: Add Shadow system in LibGDX.
data.body:
The shadow system accept point, spot and directional light.
Everything is done to help the user create his own shadow system if
needed.
See http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=18707

I know this is huge and will no be merged that way but this pull request allows us to speak about shadow system. 
I think it's a good start.

Here the demo on youtube : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xb7Q_Kx4SdA
I can connect on IRC to speak. My email is in the commit (git log).

Good luck reviewing !

data.title: 2d particle editor is broken on OSX 10.10.4 with java 1.8.0_40-b27
data.body:
Hello libgdx team,

The 2d particle editor is broken on OSX 10.10.4 with java 1.8.0_40-b27. Only a blank, unresponsive window shows up, with the cursor changed to the colorful rotating ball.
It might be related to this issue: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/3008
A simple workaround is to use it on Windows, where it's still working well.

data.title: Make G3dModelLoader customizable
data.body:
Hi,

Here is my issue : I'm customizing the json content for models, but the G3dModelLoader cannot be customized without copy/pasting the whole class.
I'm thinking about a PR to set all the parseMesh/Material/etc... methods public or protected to let them being overriden if necessary.

What do you think about this ?
Regards,
    Vincent.

data.title: Feature request - Vulkan (after released)
data.body:
It would be nice, if **libgdx** could use **Vulkan** on **Android**, after the release. More about it on http://android-developers.blogspot.de/2015/08/low-overhead-rendering-with-vulkan.html

More background information: http://blog.imgtec.com/powervr/gnomes-per-second-in-vulkan-and-opengl-es

data.title: Wiki GitHub link
data.body: I don't think the "clone on desktop" link for the wiki is working...

data.title: Modal resizable Dialog can be resized by left click-dragging anywhere on viewport
Textfield: X, C, V inserted during Cut, Copy and Paste
data.body:
When I use one of the copy and paste actions on a text field, it inserts the corresponding shortcut key as well. For example if I press Command + V (I'm on a Mac, see below) it pastes my clipboard content and then inserts a 'v' behind the pasted content. Similarly, a 'c' is inserted after copying some text and an 'x' is inserted after cutting.

To reproduce the issue you can use the UITest (one of the LibGDX tests / examples), which showcases a text field among other controls.

I tested this on OS X Yosemite, Java 8, using the latest source code.

If you can test this on your system, please leave a comment with your system specification and what behavior you experienced.

data.title: Fixed issue#3333 music and sound in classpath not load on Android.
data.body: I solve this issue : https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/3333

data.title: Fix paste method in TextField. Fixes #3337.
data.body: The paste method now takes into account that the selected text is deleted before the pasted text is inserted.

data.title: Text paste issue in TextField with max length set
data.body:
There is issue when pasting text in TextField that has maximum length set. [SSCCE](https://gist.github.com/kotcrab/682a4ba43b0b89a52cec)
1. Select all text in TextField.
2. Try to paste something in field, all text will disappear even if pasted content length is shorter than field max length. 

Expected behavior is that old text will be replaced by pasted text.

data.title: Added Slider knowDown and knobOver drawable
data.body:
This PR adds ability to set knowDown and knobOver drawable for Slider. Those are both optional so it does not affect existing sliders. 

I added protected method `getKnobDrawable` in ProgressBar and Slider overrides it, I'm not sure if there is some better way to do it.

Also fixed small Javadoc mistake.

data.title: Immersive Mode not working after onWindowFocusChanged()
Update VisUI extension
data.body: Updating VisUI extension to latest version.

data.title: newMusic in androidAudio fail for file in classpath
Add size() method to PooledLinkedList.
setUniformMatrix3fv exception
data.body:
Hi, guys!
Recently i've tried to implement batching using setUniformMatrix3fv and FloatBuffer created as:

```
ByteBuffer tmfb = ByteBuffer.allocate(16*24*SIZEOF_FLOAT);
            tmfb.order(ByteOrder.nativeOrder());
            transportMatrixFloatBuffer[i] = tmfb.asFloatBuffer();
```

Where SIZEOF_FLOAT = 4.
So each FloatBuffer contains 24 matrices of 16 floats (4*4).
But when i tried to call setUniformMatrix3fv,with count=24 and transpose=false i've got next exception:

```
A/libc Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV) at 0x00000010 (code=1), thread 22773 (Thread-16940)
```

on GLES20.glUniformMatrix4fv call.
What should i do? Thanks in advance.

data.title: libGDX Truck Factor
data.body:
As part of my PhD research on code authorship, we calculated the Truck Factor (TF) of some popular GitHub repositories.

As you probably know, the [Truck (or Bus) Factor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bus_factor) designates the minimal number of developers that have to be hit by a truck (or quit) before a project is incapacitated. In our work, we consider that a system is in trouble if more than 50% of its files become orphan (i.e., without a main author).

More details on our work in this preprint: https://peerj.com/preprints/1233

We calculated the TF for **libGDX** and obtained a value of **2**.

The developers responsible for this TF are:

Mario Zechner (badlogic) - author of 52% of the files
Xoppa - author of 32% of the files

To validate our results, we would like to ask **libGDX** developers the following three brief questions:

(a) Do you agree that the listed developers are the main developers of **libGDX**?

(b) Do you agree that **libGDX** will be in trouble if the listed developers leave the project (e.g., if they win in the lottery, to be less morbid)?

(c) Does **libGDX** have some characteristics that would attenuate the loss of the listed developers (e.g., detailed documentation)?

Thanks in advance for your collaboration,

Guilherme Avelino
PhD Student
Applied Software Engineering Group (ASERG)
UFMG, Brazil
http://aserg.labsoft.dcc.ufmg.br/

data.title: MouseListener methods trigger inconsistently on LwjglCanvas on Windows 10
LwjglCanvas hangs on exit on Windows 10
Json nested Array/Maps deserialization
data.body:
I've observed an inconsistent behaviour while trying to deserialize nested Arrays/Maps.

I've attached 3 test cases.
1. **NestedArrayDeserialization**: Deserializes an `ObjectMap<String, Array<CutomObject>>`
   http://pastebin.com/kqSSqeHN
2. **NestedArrayListDeserialization**: Deserializes an `ObjectMap<String, ArrayList<CutomObject>>`
   http://pastebin.com/xPsDsXWL
3. **DoubleNestedArrayDeserialization**: Deserializes an `ObjectMap<String, ObjectMap<String, ArrayList<CutomObject>>>`
   http://pastebin.com/1rcd5bzC

Test 1 runs OK. Test 2 and 3 fail with different errors.

As a reference I've found a similar post where this could not be answered because of lack of information (sample cases): http://badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=11016.

It may be that current libGDX Json implementation doesn't support the possibility to inform about the types of the "values" of a Map but it's currently not clear in the documentation how nested Maps and Arrays  should be deserialized.

In GSON for example it's possible to provide a type token in the following manner and the library  takes care of the rest: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14358350/google-gson-nested-hashmaps-deserialization.

data.title: fixed bug where copying a directory into another directory wasn't creating the correct file hierarchy.
data.body:
So basically, if you had a file tree like so:

```
/tmp
    /foo
        /test.txt
    /bar
```

where foo and bar are both sub directories of tmp and you tried to move foo into bar using FileHandle.moveTo(), the resulting hierarchy would look like this:

```
/tmp
    /bar
        /test.txt
```

the foo directory would just disappear. The expected file hierarchy would be:

```
/tmp
    /bar
        /foo
            /test.txt
```

This is what the changes in this PR accomplishes.
